thread.title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open
thread.title_full: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open

title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open
text:
Eugene Hoshiko Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open 
Benoit Paire of France returns a shot against Nick Kyrgios, of Australia, during their singles quarterfinal match at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko) Eugene Hoshiko Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open 
Kei Nishikori of Japan returns a shot against Marin Cilic, of Croatia during their singles quarterfinal match at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko) Eugene Hoshiko Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open 
Kei Nishikori of Japan returns a shot against Marin Cilic, of Croatia during their singles quarterfinal match at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko) Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 12:31 am | Updated: 3:01 am, Sat Oct 10, 2015. Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open Associated Press | 
TOKYO (AP) — Benoit Paire of France beat defending champion and local favorite Kei Nishikori 1-6, 6-4, 6-2 on Saturday to advance to the final of the Japan Open. 
The unseeded Paire took the second set with a backhand winner to break the second-seeded Nishikori, who was bidding for his third Japan Open title. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety. You
